intro: Ardisia lepidula, commonly known as the smooth ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, white to pale pink flowers. Its fruit is a bright red berry that contains several seeds. Ardisia lepidula is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and woodlands.
